questions.question: She was anxious ……………………………… her husband hadn’t returned yet.
questions.description: Because gives the reason for something.

questions.question: ……………………………… you miss another deadline, you will be sacked.
…………………………… he is old, he cannot walk properly.
I will not permit this …………………………… it is against my principles.
You can go ……………………………. you have finished that report.
……………………………. you are not feeling well, I will take you to the doctor.
………………………………… I pleaded for help, he didn’t move.
questions.description: Even though is used to emphasize a contrast.

questions.question: She worked ................................... hard that her health deteriorated.
questions.description: We use so before an adjective.

questions.question: The faster you run, ……………………………. you get tired.
questions.description: The comparative is used in both clauses in this structure.

questions.question: …………………………. he was the most popular candidate, he got eliminated in the first round itself.
questions.description: Though is used to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: This is the store ………………………….. they sell fish.
